isis.stitle: TSI 98-12-18 - In Chassis Cleaning Procedure for Vehicle Cooling Package

subjectgroup.subject: In Chassis Cleaning Procedure for Vehicle Cooling Package

geninfo.para: This TSI applies to AmTran 3000RE bus.

Charge air cooler fin clogging can cause low power as the engine reduces fuel delivery to compensate for above normal coolant temperatures. This has mainly been noticed on units with T 444E engines utilizing the exhaust back pressure device in colder climates.

A 24 inch crankcase breather tube extension was added in production on April 28, 1998 to minimize oily crankcase vapors from being drawn into the engine compartment and forced into the charge air cooler. Additionally, any fluid leaks greater than seepage can cause CAC clogging.

note.para: Engine compartment fluid leaks should be repaired as soon as possible to prevent CAC clogging.

geninfo.para: The following procedure is recommended as an annual maintenance program to ensure road salts and debris are removed from the cooling package to insure optimum performance and reliability.

note.para: Air management flip up panels should be closed and latched when the bus is in service to prevent excessive contaminants from entering the engine compartment.

entry.para: Deck Sprayer with Flexible Extension Wand and Fan Tip
Garden Hose with Pistol Grip Nozzle

step1.para: Mix Simple Green cleaner in a 50/50 mixture with water in the sprayer tank.

Spray charge air cooler from engine side with Simple Green cleaning solution. Use the technicians mirror and flashlight to insure full and even coverage with the cleaning solution. Allow the cleaning solution to soak 20 to 30 minutes. Additional cleaning solution may be applied to heavily plugged areas.
Remove the engine oil drain plug cover from the air management panel to open a path for water to drain out.
Apply cleaning solution to the radiator from the rear of the bus.

caution.para: Do not spray charge air cooler or radiator fins at an angle as fin damage may occur and reduce cooling efficiency.
Do not attempt to clean the charge air cooler from the engine side with a pressure washer as damage to the charge air cooler fins will reduce cooling efficiency.

step1.para: After the soak period, pressure wash or steam clean the cooling package from the rear of the bus. Thoroughly clean each row of fins slowly vertically then horizontally. This process should take approximately 10 minutes.

Rinse the charge air cooler with the garden hose and nozzle from the engine side. Spray water at a 45 degree angle or less to dislodge and rinse debris from the charge air cooler. Inspect the fins with the technicians mirror and the flashlight to insure adequate cleaning.
Return to the radiator side and pressure wash following Step 6 for approximately 5 minutes to remove any remaining debris.
Rinse the cooling package and engine compartment with clean water to remove any cleaning solution residue.
Perform a final inspection of the cooling package using the technicians mirror and flashlight. If areas were missed, spot clean those areas following the above procedure Steps.
Re-install the grille and engine oil drain plug cover.
Disconnect the fan clutch wiring harness and run the engine at high idle for approximately 3 minutes to dry the cooling package.
Turn off the engine and reconnect the fan clutch wiring harness.
